item.title: SystemTap 2.5 Supports UEFI/SecureBoot & Other Features
item.description: SystemTap 2.5 is now available as the latest version of this open-source Linux software for being like DTrace in being able to dynamically trace and diagnose system issues...

item.title: BerkeleyDB 6 Is Being Added For Fedora 21
item.description: Another Wednesday brings another Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee meeting where new features for Fedora 21 were approved...

item.title: Trying Out The Jetson TK1, NVIDIA's High-End Tegra K1 Board
item.description: While it looks like most NVIDIA Jetson TK1 shipments were delayed (I've heard in Europe that they're not coming out as well until mid-May, matching what NewEgg and Micro-Center are now advertising), to much excitement I found out last night my Jetson TK1 ARM board shipped out and it's already arrived this morning. Here's my unboxing and first look at this new high-end ARM board featuring the Tegra K1 SoC that sports Kepler graphics.

item.title: Oracle Solaris 11.2 Now Available In Beta Form
item.description: Oracle has put out the first public beta of the forthcoming Solaris 11.2 operating system release. The big focus of Solaris 11.2 is on embracing support for cloud computing...

item.title: Firefox 30 Beta Finally Supports GStreamer 1.0
item.description: Following the Firefox 29.0 release, Firefox 30.0 is now in Mozilla's beta channel. One of the changes for Linux users with this next major web-browser update is finally support for the GStreamer 1.0 API...

item.title: Red Hat Buys Out Inktank For $175 Million
item.description: Red Hat's latest major acquisition is that of Inktank, the company behind the Ceph file-system...

item.title: Qt 5.3 Release Candidate Planned For End Of Week
item.description: The official release candidate for the upcoming Qt 5.3 toolkit should be released before the weekend. For those interested in testing out the latest Qt 5.3 release right now, there's a new development candidate...

item.title: KDE 4.12.5 Has Almost 10 Recorded Bug-Fixes
item.description: KDE 4.12.5 for its Application and Development Platform are now available and it also comes along with KDE Plasma Workspaces 4.11.9...

item.title: Ubuntu 14.10 Release Schedule Now Online
item.description: The release date for Ubuntu 14.10 has now been firmed up as are the other development milestones leading up to the mid-October debut of this post-LTS release...

item.title: Intel Ultrabook Benchmarks On The Linux 3.15 Kernel
item.description: Now that things are settling down with Linux 3.15, here's some fresh benchmarks of the Linux 3.15 kernel off an ASUS Zenbook Prime.

item.title: New X.Org Synaptics Driver Improves Touchpad Support
item.description: A second development snapshot of the xf86-input-synaptics DDX driver is now available with some changes to improve its touchpad support for modern laptops and ultrabooks...

item.title: Red Hat Developers Propose Wayland For Fedora 21
item.description: After being an optional, experimental feature in Fedora 20, Wayland with GNOME 3.14 might be getting ready to take on the default Fedora 21 desktop...

item.title: OpenSUSE Conference 2014 Videos Posted
item.description: Running the past few days in Croatia was the annual openSUSE Conference...

item.title: NVIDIA's Tegra TK1 Jetson Board Is Now Shipping
item.description: NVIDIA's very interesting Jetson TK1 ARM development board is now shipping! This is the interesting ARM development board that's priced sub-$200 and powered by the Tegra K1 that has a Kepler GPU...

item.title: New X.Org Being Added To Rawhide For Fedora 21
item.description: For users of Fedora "Rawhide", the latest X.Org code is soon to land well in time for Fedora 21...

item.title: Intel Cherryview PCI IDs Get Added To Mesa DRM
item.description: Going back to last month has been initial open-source Linux graphics driver support for Cherryview, the next-generation Atom SoCs, and now the PCI IDs have been added to Mesa's DRM library code...

item.title: Debian Drops Support For SPARC
item.description: Debian has removed their SPARC CPU architecture support from Debian 8.0 "Jessie" testing and it might also be removed from Debian unstable as well...

item.title: GNU Mailman 3.0 Now In Beta
item.description: The GNU Mailman 3.0 open-source mailing list software is finally in beta after a major rewrite...

item.title: Debian 7.5 GNU/Linux Released
item.description: The fifth update to Debian 7 "Wheezy" is now available...

item.title: Zenwalk Is Likely Doing Away With 32-Bit Support
item.description: The Live edition of Zenwalk Linux 7.4 has been announced and it does away with the OpenSSL Heartbleed issue and other problems. This Zenwalk Linux release also does away with the AuFS-enabled kernel...

item.title: X.Org Server 1.16 ABI Breakage Causes Concern
item.description: A late breakage to the X.Org Server 1.16 ABI is resulting in (arguably rightful) concern by the proprietary driver developers at NVIDIA...

item.title: AMD Shows Off Beema & Mullins But Its Linux Fate Is Unclear
item.description: AMD has now revealed their newest APUs, codenamed "Beema" and "Mullins" while their Linux fate remains unclear...

item.title: X.Org's Evdev Driver Shows Off Improvements
item.description: Peter Hutterer of Red Hat released an updated xf86-input-evdev driver on Monday for improving this common X.Org input driver...

item.title: Xamarin Studio Working On New Debugging Support
item.description: For those using Xamarin Studio for their Mono app development, the integrated development environment will soon be featuring some enhancements for an improved debugging experience...

item.title: GCC Ada Now Supports 64-bit ARM
item.description: The Ada programming language as compiled by GCC now has support for 64-bit ARM (AArch64) architectures...

item.title: Yocto Is Hooking Up With AMD & Mentor Graphics
item.description: The Linux Foundation will be announcing tomorrow that AMD and Mentor Graphics are partnering up with the embedded Yocto Linux project as advisory members...

item.title: Testing NVIDIA Optimus / DRI PRIME On Ubuntu 14.04
item.description: With Ubuntu 14.04 LTS there is improved support for multi-GPU laptops (commonly what's branded as NVIDIA Optimus configurations) where there is a discrete NVIDIA GPU used for high performance workloads to complement the low-power Intel integrated graphics. Ubuntu 14.04 LTS features better support for these Optimus / DRI PRIME configurations on both the open and closed-source graphics drivers. Here's the Ubuntu 14.04 multi-GPU experience along with some OpenGL benchmarks and power consumption numbers between the different configurations.

item.title: Firefox 29.0 For Linux Is Now Available For Download
item.description: While we're still waiting on the official release announcement, Mozilla Firefox 29.0 is now available for download...

item.title: Ubuntu 14.10 Utopic Can Now Boot With Systemd
item.description: Just days after Ubuntu 14.10 opened for development, a systemd package has landed within the "Utopic Unicorn" package archive that allows the Ubuntu desktop to be booted via systemd rather than Upstart...

item.title: Rolling Out A New Phoronix Test Suite Site
item.description: Over the weekend an incrementally new Phoronix Test Suite web-design was rolled out...

item.title: Inkscape 0.91 Is Still Working Towards Its Major Feature Release
item.description: It's been a long time since the last major release of the Inkscape open-source vector graphics editor software, but the 0.91 release (formerly known as Inkscape 0.49) is still brewing and will be a very exciting release with a ton of new functionality...

item.title: 64-bit MenuetOS M64 0.99.57 Released
item.description: The Menuet operating system that's lightweight, cleanly written in Assembly x86, and not based upon another OS platform, had a new version release last week of its 64-bit "M64" platform...

item.title: Intel Begins Lining Up Their Graphics Changes For Linux 3.16
item.description: Intel has submitted their first drm-next pull request of the Intel Linux graphics driver changes aimed for the Linux 3.16 kernel...

item.title: HGST Travelstar 7K1000 2.5-Inch 1TB SATA 3.0 HDD
item.description: Being benchmarked today at Phoronix under Linux is the HGST Travelstar 7K1000 1000GB 7200RPM Serial ATA 3.0 2.5-inch internal HDD.

item.title: Clpeak: OpenCL Device Profiling On Linux
item.description: Clpeak is a relatively new open-source tool for querying the peak capabilities of OpenCL devices under Linux...

item.title: xf86-video-modesetting Now Supports Server-Managed FDs
item.description: The generic xf86-video-modesetting DDX driver that's designed to work universally across Linux KMS drivers now has support for sever-managed file-descriptors, which will help this driver work on non-root X Servers...
